us.title: Dot Plot, Inflation Expectations: What to Watch in FOMC Announcement
us.content: Ahead of the Fed's latest interest rate decision, Kevin Green maps out a watch list for investors to look for in the central bank's comments and Jerome Powell's speech. He points to the Trump administration's tariff policy as a potential talking point, as the Fed may be wary to cut too soon.

us.title: Nasdaq heading for another rebound ahead of Fed decision later
us.content: US stocks are being tipped to open higher today ahead of the Federal Reserve decision later. Ahead of the opening bell, S&P 500 futures were up 0.2% and Dow Jones futures just above flat, while Nasdaq 100 futures were up 0.3%.

us.title: Canadian Net REIT Announces the Issuance of Units for Services Rendered and Grant of Performance Units in Relation With Its Unit Compensation Plan
us.content: MONTRÉAL, March 19, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- (TSX-V: NET.UN) Canadian Net Real Estate Investment Trust (“Canadian Net” or the “Trust”) announces the issuance of 36,577 units of the Trust at a price of $5.68 per unit, which equates to $207,757, and 106,710 deferred trust units as partial compensation for the services rendered by certain employees, members of management and the board of trustees during the fiscal year ended on December 31st, 2024.

us.title: The Market's Path After The Fed Meeting
us.content: The Fed's March 19, 2025, meeting is pivotal, with potential market paths depending on the interpretation of the Fed's stance. A dovish Fed could spark an immediate massive rally, while a hawkish stance might lead to further market declines, testing key support levels.

france.title: Cereal Giant General Mills Stock Drops on Downbeat Outlook
france.content: General Mills (GIS) shares are falling in premarket trading Wednesday after the cereal giant issued a downbeat outlook and posted quarterly sales that undershot forecasts.

france.title: Market Fear Creates A Chance To Buy Alphabet Stock
france.content: Alphabet's diverse revenue streams, including YouTube, Cloud, and AI, offer significant growth potential despite uncertainties in the search business. The Wiz acquisition, though costly, aligns with Alphabet's history of successful integrations like YouTube, promising long-term returns and/or innovation. Alphabet's strong balance sheet and cash flow mitigate risks associated with large acquisitions, ensuring financial stability and growth.

france.title: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang Declares 2025 as AI's ‘Inflection Point’ at GTC Conference
france.content:
NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ: NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang described GTC 2025 as the "Super Bowl of AI," marking a pivotal moment for the artificial intelligence industry. During his keynote, Huang outlined four distinct waves of AI evolution and addressed the growing computational demands that define the current phase of development.

The Four Waves of AI According to Jensen Huang

  1. Perception AI (Initiated ~10 years ago):

    • Focused on basic tasks like speech recognition and image classification.

  2. Generative AI (Last 5 years):

    • Characterized by models like ChatGPT, MidJourney, and DALL-E that generate text and images based on predictive patterns.

  3. Agentic AI (Current phase):

    • Focuses on autonomous digital interactions and complex reasoning models that perform tasks independently.
    • Huang emphasized that Agentic AI requires 100x more tokens and computational resources than initially anticipated due to the intricate steps involved in reasoning processes.

  4. Physical AI (Future phase):

    • Envisions AI integration into real-world applications such as humanoid robots and advanced automation systems.

AI’s Computational Demand and NVIDIA’s Response

Huang highlighted that the rapidly increasing demand for computational power is being addressed effectively. Notably:

  • NVIDIA’s Hopper GPUs peaked at 1.3 million units shipped in a year for top cloud service providers such as Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN), Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), Meta (NASDAQ: META), and Google (NASDAQ: GOOGL).
  • For NVIDIA’s upcoming Blackwell GPUs, scheduled for 2025, the company has already secured orders for 3.6 million units — a nearly threefold increase.

Huang stressed that this exponential growth underscores AI’s inflection point, where the technology is rapidly becoming more powerful, accessible, and widely adopted.

Key Implications for Investors and Tech Markets

  • Cloud Service Providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.) are scaling their AI infrastructure aggressively to meet rising computational demands.
  • NVIDIA’s dominance in the AI hardware segment positions it as a key beneficiary of this technological shift.
  • The development of Agentic AI — with its increased reliance on tokens and reasoning models — suggests higher demand for GPUs and accelerated data center expansion.

Relevant FMP APIs for Tracking AI-Driven Market Trends

✅ Stock Market Data API
Monitor NVIDIA’s stock performance alongside key players like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google to assess AI-related market trends.

✅ Earnings Calendar API
Stay updated on upcoming earnings reports from NVIDIA and other AI-focused firms to track revenue growth driven by increased GPU sales.

Conclusion

Jensen Huang’s assertion that AI has reached its "inflection point" signals a transformative era for technology, with NVIDIA playing a central role. As demand for powerful GPUs continues to surge — particularly for Agentic AI applications — NVIDIA’s strategic positioning makes it a crucial player in this evolving landscape. For investors and tech enthusiasts, this underscores the importance of tracking NVIDIA’s growth alongside broader AI market trends.

france.title: Bank OZK: A Buy After Another Strong Year - Here's My Strategy
france.content: Amid heightened political uncertainties and increasing expectations of a recession, OZK shares have given back all of their post-election gains. Such a situation naturally attracts value investors, but also skeptics, as OZK is heavily exposed to commercial real estate. Based on the 2024 results reported in January, I will take a fresh look at OZK's operations and explain why I am increasingly optimistic despite a rather pessimistic market sentiment.

france.title: Fund managers dump US stocks at record pace — Can recession fears hurt Bitcoin?
france.content: Bitcoin's (BTC) price action has closely mirrored that of the US equity market in recent years, particularly the tech-heavy Nasdaq and the benchmark S&P 500. Now, as fund managers stage a historic exodus from US stocks, the question arises: could Bitcoin be the next casualty?

france.title: Snipe: Skepticism is the word of the day, as the market digests recent volatility
france.content: Jason Snipe, Principal & CIO of Odyssey Capital Advisors, discusses market skepticism, the Fed's neutral stance, and highlights Fiserv as a strong pick, citing its growth and resilience in the economy.

france.title: Missed BinaryX 60% Pump? Market Technicians See Same Patterns in This New Tokenization Token
france.content: If you missed the recent 60% surge in BinaryX (BNX), there's good news—another exciting opportunity is emerging. Coldware (COLD), a new tokenization project, is gaining attention in the market, and experts are drawing comparisons to BinaryX's (BNX) growth patterns.

france.title: 3 Canadian Marijuana Stocks To Watch For Future Gains 2025
france.content: Marijuana stocks have been facing a downward trend in the market for some time. A big reason is regulatory uncertainty and reform issues. Legislative changes, particularly in major markets like the U.S., can greatly affect how shareholders think. Additionally, oversupply in certain regions has led to falling prices, which negatively affects revenue for companies in the sector. This has created a volatile sector where the trading behavior of the most public companies is more on the low end.

france.title: Crown Provides Update on Nasdaq Delisting
france.content: LOS ANGELES, March 19, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Crown Electrokinetics Corp. (OTC: CRKN) ("Crown" or the "Company”), a leading provider of innovative technology infrastructure solutions that benefit communities and the environment, today announced that the Nasdaq Hearings Panel has declined Crown's request to reconsider its March 3, 2025, decision to delist the Company's common stock from The Nasdaq Stock Market. Following this determination, Crown immediately prepared and filed an appeal on March 18, 2025, requesting further review of the delisting decision. While this appeal does not guarantee reinstatement, it represents the next step in the process with Nasdaq.

france.title: The Fed Decides | Live Coverage Starts at 1:30 pm ET
france.content: The Federal Reserve releases its latest interest rate decision today at 2 pm ET. While the Fed is expected to hold rates steady, its quarterly dot plot should offer clues on the central bank's thinking on the economy.
